Clip.Title: QUEST
Clip.Episode: SETI: Planet Hunters, The New Search for ET and Quest Lab: Aerogel
Clip.EpisodeSummary: Do other planets like Earth exist? Find out why a team of astronomers in the US has built a new telescope to look for planets outside our solar system. And, is anyone out there? Find out why SETI scientists now say we might be hearing from ET sooner than you think. And, Aerogel is a unique man made substance that insulates space suits, makes tennis rackets stronger and could be used one day to clean up oil spills.

Clip.Title: QUEST
Clip.Episode: Disappearing Frogs, The Lost Salmon and Why I Do Science: Bob Drewes
Clip.EpisodeSummary: Pollution, disease and climate change are threatening frogs around the world. And for the first time ever, a sharp decline in salmon numbers prompted officials to cancel an entire fishing season in 2008 in the ocean off the Western United States. Where did the salmon go? Finally, meet herpetologist Bob Drewes and find out how he turned his passion for frogs into a lifelong career.

Clip.Title: RESURRECTION SCIENCE
Clip.EpisodeSummary: This is the story of science's latest frontier: a global scientific investigation into DNA sequencing and bio-molecular cloning, to understand how scientists around the world are competing to be the first to rewrite the history of our planet and resurrect creatures from the past.

Clip.Title: GREEN PARADISE
Clip.EpisodeSummary: Discover destinations around the world, where local economies protect natural resources and wildlife diversity.

Clip.Title: GREEN PARADISE
Clip.EpisodeSummary: Discover destinations around the world, where local economies protect natural resources and wildlife diversity.

Clip.Title: MAGNIFICA ITALIA
Clip.EpisodeSummary: Naples, the city that fascinates through its music, its thousand churches, its traditions and tastes. Between present and past the ancient origins of this land that makes Italy known worldwide are reflected in the blue waters of the charming tirrenian coasts.

Clip.Title: CANADA: OVER THE EDGE
Clip.EpisodeSummary: High above the St. Lawrence River and into the Gulf of St. Lawrence, an aerial survey above the Gaspe peninsula reveals a set of natural wonders - from the Blue Whales to the stone marvels.

Clip.Title: RITES OF PASSAGE
Clip.EpisodeSummary: Exploring birth, death, coming of age and marriage through different cultural and religious perspectives.

Clip.Title: RITES OF PASSAGE
Clip.EpisodeSummary: Exploring birth, death, coming of age and marriage through different cultural and religious perspectives.

Clip.Title: CANADA: OVER THE EDGE
Clip.EpisodeSummary: From the highlands of the Americas to the world-famous tidal flats of the Bay of Fundy, this exploration of Nova Scotia reveals some of the world's best-kept secrets - here, on the edge of Canada.

Clip.Title: THE BIONIC VET
Clip.EpisodeSummary: The Bionic Vet performs revolutionary surgical techniques to save the lives of his four legged patients. See Oscar the cat get a bionic foot transplant and Mayo the arthritic dog, an "X-Men" inspired surgical procedure.

Clip.Title: UNDERSEA EDENS
Clip.EpisodeSummary: About the size of Texas, the island country of Papua New Guinea sits just to the North of Australia. At Papua's far eastern tip lies Milne Bay - holding one of the planet's highest concentrations of marine species.

Clip.Title: LIONS IN BATTLE
Clip.EpisodeSummary: After a harsh season, the lionesses of The Okavango Delta in southern Africa struggle to feed their cubs, often entering enemy territory to find food to save their pride.

Clip.Title: TURF WAR: LIONS AND HIPPOS
Clip.EpisodeSummary: The merciless dry season has scorched Africa's Luangwa Rift Valley and ignited an extraordinary battle between the king of beasts and their three-ton foes. Here on the banks of a dwindling river, lions and hippos fight for territory along this last source of life, a clash that grows more heated as the water level continues to drop. Enter a world where deadly force meets lethal power, where cubs and calves become collateral damage, and where a bull's fearsome leadership and a mother lion's devotion set the stage for a true-life drama.

Clip.Title: AERIAL FRANCE
Clip.EpisodeSummary: Get an up close look at the beautiful French landscape from above and a taste of the rich culture on the stunning coasts.

Clip.Title: WALRUS TV
Clip.EpisodeSummary: In depth vignettes on issues impacting modern Canadians, taken from the pages of the popular Magazine.

Clip.Title: WALRUS TV
Clip.EpisodeSummary: In depth vignettes on issues impacting modern Canadians, taken from the pages of the popular Magazine.

Clip.Title: STORIES FROM THE VAULTS
Clip.EpisodeSummary: What does the Smithsonian have to do with food? Join host Tom Cavanagh as he learns to cook Native American dishes with the executive chef of Mitsitam Cafe; experience the American coffee break with the National Museum of American History, and visit the National Museum of Dentistry.

Clip.Title: STORIES FROM THE VAULTS
Clip.EpisodeSummary: Join host Tom Cavanagh as he takes you behind the scenes to examine the treasures, secret symbols, and coded messages that you can find at the Smithsonian. With the help of curators and other experts, we unlock some of the Smithsonian's most compelling mysteries.

Clip.Title: THE REAL STORY
Clip.EpisodeSummary: We take an in-depth, behind-the-scenes look at the CIA to see how a super assassin like Matt Damon's conflicted hero is created. We also probe the intelligence agency's controversial past operations, involving sinister mind-control experiments and often bizarre assassination plots.

Clip.Title: DESIGN TRIENNIEL
Clip.EpisodeSummary: Join host Susan Spencer as we enter the Cooper Hewitt National Design Museum, where curators have assembled a remarkable collection of groundbreaking innovations that are making the world safer, more comfortable, and energy efficient.

Clip.Title: STORIES FROM THE VAULTS

Join host Tom Cavanagh as he learns to cook Native American dishes with the executive chef of Mitsitam Cafe; experience the American coffee break with the National Museum of American History, and visit the National Museum of Dentistry.
